universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Interface Pullable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Scrollable

    public interface Pullable
extends Scrollable
    Interface for pullable views. Specifies API for supporting the pull feature for view groups of which content can be pulled down/up or right/left by a user. Enabling the pull feature for the pullable view can be done via setPullEnabled(boolean). Whether to pull the pullable view horizontally or vertically is determined by orientation flag returned by the pullable view from Scrollable.getOrientation() method.

    Note, that only scrollable views like ListView or HorizontalScrollView should support this feature.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Pullable.OnPullListener
      Listener which can receive callbacks about the started, performed, released or collapsed pull.
      static interface  Pullable.OnPullOverflowListener
      Listener which can receive callback about the pull overflow.
      static interface  Pullable.Pull
      A layer that provides access to current pull data.

        getOrientation, isScrolledAtEnd, isScrolledAtStart

    • Method Detail

      • setPullEnabled

        void setPullEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the pull feature is enabled within this view or not.

        Enabling this feature means, that a user can pull down/up or right/left this view depending on its orientation specified by Scrollable.getOrientation().

        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable pull, false to disable it.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullEnabled, isPullEnabled()

      • isPullEnabled

        boolean isPullEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the pull feature is enabled within this view or not.
        Returns:
        True if the pull enabled, so a user can pull content of this view, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setPullEnabled(boolean)
